Title: AMD64 x86 emulation GTK+ library: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
Synopsis:
Multiple integer overflow vulnerabilities in the AMD64 x86 emulation GTK+
    libraries may result in the execution of arbitrary code in applications
    using Cairo.

Background.Text: Cairo is a 2D vector graphics library with cross-device output support. The AMD64 x86 emulation GTK+ library packages Cairo libraries for 32bit x86 emulation on AMD64.

Description.Text: The Cairo versions used by the AMD64 x86 emulation GTK+ libraries were vulnerable to integer overflow vulnerabilities (GLSA 200712-04).

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could entice a user to view or process a specially crafted PNG image file in an application linked against Cairo, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text:
All AMD64 x86 emulation GTK+ library users should upgrade to the latest
    version:
